column5: If not most... This is a vital artery from the US and the Niagara  region, a lot of economic commerce begins along this route. To say this is major would be an understatement. This will cost a lot more then just the repair to the bridge itself.  The federal government should get involved as this is a major trade route.  Hopefully mister Singh is prosecuted to the fullest extent of the law, loses his license and is made to pay restitution..  I travel the 401 daily for work.... And the crap these truckers do should land a lot of them in jail...  Hopefully they get this sorted out soon as I can see the oil companies having yet another excuse   G
Hopefully they get this sorted out soon as I can see the oil companies having yet another excuse  They bumped ours up yesterday  from $1.22 - $1.29

If not most... This is a vital artery from the US and the Niagara region, a lot of economic commerce begins along this route. To say this is major would be an understatement. This will cost a lot more then just the repair to the bridge itself.  The federal government should get involved as this is a major trade route.  Hopefully mister Singh is prosecuted to the fullest extent of the law, loses his license and is made to pay restitution..  I travel the 401 daily for work.... And the crap these truckers do should land a lot of them in jail...  Hopefully they get this sorted out soon as I can see the oil companies having yet another excuse   G  Oil companies need an excuse? Every time I went further into Ontario than Niagara Falls I crossed that bridge, and I can only imagine the headaches and problem with it will involve.  Part of the breakup of the unions and union drivers? In no way am I claiming they were all perfect. You own a trucking company, leased drivers or independent drivers are the way to go? Oh, they don't work for us, you can't hold us responsible for their mistakes?  Even if you require them to have a million dollar liability coverage policy? Will it even begin to cover that actual costs. Then there is the old saying about squeezing blood out of a rock? How many ordinary people could even begin to pay the costs of repairs in a lifetime of work.
chiot !! ( it means puppy in French )
80,000 cars a day cross it..
FYI the Skyway Bridge is open again  Update - the QEW is closed both ways at Walkers in Burlington due to flooding  Good luck to all the long weekend travelers trying to get thru the mess

FYI the Skyway Bridge is open again  Update - the QEW is closed both ways at Walkers in Burlington due to flooding  Good luck to all the long weekend travelers trying to get thru the mess  Thank God eh Rick? I can imagine your blood pressure rising driving that to and from work every day.  Flooding? We didn't have a drop of rain up here yesterday, wow!
While at work I had remarked how Burlington was getting hammered. Little did I know how bad it was...
This mornings news said about 600 Burlington homes had their basements flooded and seeing as how the water came in through the windows & doors, none of it will be covered by insurance.

I remember that year Rich what a PITA that drive was. Are you heading north tomorrow the 2nd or the next week the 9th? We're at Memquisit starting the 9th so I'm hoping things will be relatively normal by then but we come thru very early to get north of 400 before the traffic gets too bad. We'll be at the border by 5:00AM  Leaving early tomorrow morning.  I won't be hitting the border until somewhere around 9:30am / 10:00am.

Leaving early tomorrow morning.  I won't be hitting the border until somewhere around 9:30am / 10:00am.  Might be better for you to hit the road much earlier Rich, this is a long weekend up here and there'll be LOTS of folks travelling the highways. Fred's got the right idea of getting thru that stretch of road VERY early.

an aside, rosehill construction can't get lucky....  concreate goes under....bonds called on all mto jobs....  restructures to be rosehill construction, gets all the contracts to complete the jobs that concreate failed.....including this bridge.  a drunk idiot drives into their construction project....causing huge issues beyond what the newspapers are reporting.  some companies just have bad luck.
concreate usl lol  what a joke
yep. concreate usl sure was.  rosehill construction? only time will tell.  this sure was bad luck....can't blame rosehill on this one!
Add to that, it's also Caribanna weekend & it's gonna be busy @ the border as well. If I was you, I'd be doing like many others have suggested and change your travel times to earlier morning.
OK - Who's bright idea was it to schedule the fishing trip this week anyway

My buddy who lives in St.Catharines and works in Hamilton said it took him over 2hrs to get into work today..  And he didn't even have to cross the bridge.  I was planning on going down there this weekend, but not anymore.

bill, the city is screwed.  i'm up on the mountain. didn't go to work today.  every street that goes east west is screwed.  fennell. mohawk. stone church. rymal. the link. redhill south. 403 east.  no one can move anywhere.
It's amazing how much trouble can be caused by one guys stupid act.

your right Lew.  it even goes further.  if your a boater in the harbour, due to the traffic issues, they are only raising the lift bridge once an hour....and this, I understand, is 24 hours a day.  So if you use the lift bridge launch, and want to fish lake ontario, and cannot get underneath the bridge, you'll have to wait to the "once an hour" lift....  in the past it would be lifted as needed...which could be as much as five-six times an hour.  as a result, many boats are going to be waiting a long time to get out of the harbour....  if you are a boater that can't fit underneath, maybe it would be best to find a new launch for this weekend.

as a result, many boats are going to be waiting a long time to get out of the harbour..  Just a guess here Steve, but I imagine any big freighters will get priority over pleasure craft passing through there.

they actually were filming a big freighter moving through the canal when the OPP was being interviewed.  the copper mentioned the port authority is aware of the time per hour of the lift and will be advising the freighters accordingly.  it would be nice if they post the time per hour of the lift so the rec boaters aren't guessing when it'll be.
Giving serious consideration of leaving tonite and driving straight through to hit the area around daybreak.   Just gotta stay awake

Giving serious consideration of leaving tonite and driving straight through to hit the area around daybreak. Just gotta stay awake I would suggest that may be a good idea, you will lose at least two hours probably more if you hit the area anytime after 6 am.
Get the coffee going when you arrive, Rich.......don't think I'll be there much before 2PM. Safe drive my friend.
Appreciate all the comments and suggestions guys.   Much appreciated.

Rich, If I was you I'd run up to Niagara or even St Catherines tonight. Then get up at 4:00 or so and blow through the before the poop hits the fan tomorrow. The delays this type of thing causes brings out the very best in drivers Regardless of what you do, hope it works out for the best and good luck on the trip.
Theres a 55 inch ski waiting for ya when you get there for all the troubles, if Lew doesnt beat you to it
Yeah.  I can't leave here much before 10:00 or 11:00 tonite  and a good 6+hours to Niagara
Then I am definitely leaving tonite.  !!!!!!!!

WOW!!!! One of a ton of roads is closed and mass hysteria ensues!!!! Our one and only road back to civilization has been closed more than open over the last month due to a 1.6 million acre fire!! So far today it has been open for 2 hours and 20 minutes. This would be the road that all of our food and supplies come up on.
and if you had the population of southern ontario, you would understand. (as such, I'll excuse your "wow")
I recall going over that bridge many times, it is probably going to be a real shocker for some tourists?
and if you had the population of southern ontario, you would understand. (as such, I'll excuse your "wow")  I grew up there. Just having a little fun with y'all.
Oh, this is going to make things fun this long weekend. http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/large-crash--involving-dump-truck-shuts-down-burlington-skyway/33103/
Almost got stuck in that today, instead opted to take the work truck home haha. I wonder what's going to happen to the driver of the truck?
oh man .... this will cause kaos!! Glad I fish mostly the Niagara way
Not good, that bridge will be closed for a long time by the time engineers get done with it. 2 way on the new skyway coming up I think.
. I wonder what's going to happen to the driver of the truck?  a situation that 'Oh crap!" doesn't quite cover!!!!  (Funny, the S word got changed automatically to the C word!!)
Well now that's just ducky - figuring I'm coming through there Saturday am.    CRAP

Go figures,  just a few minutes ago I look out and notice a CRAP tonne of traffic on King St. in hamilton. Thought maybe there was a big concert tonight downtown or something. Everyones jumping onto the 403 for obvious reasons.  Missed the news tonight, thankfully I saw this thread. Will have to give the girlfriend the heads up to leave for work tomorrow morning a little earlier
went over the skyway a week ago both ways picking up my 'new' boat in stoney creek! that would not have been fun trying to get home with the new toy!

Well now that's just ducky - figuring I'm coming through there Saturday am. CRAP There is a way around, take Regional 20 out of Niagara Falls, to Hamilton, then go through Dundas on Olympic drive up to Hwy 5, Hwy 5 to 407 and you're golden. Look on a map to see what I mean.
google maps is your friend.  you could always take QEW to Redhill Pkwy Exit Barton St. head east Take Barton to Gage Ave, left on Gage Right on King St Follow King to 403  Good luck
I was trying to avoid the 403
Thank you.   I'll be sure to check it out.  I use the 407 coming through.   Thanks again
It is a real mess up there. Got to do the drive by coming home from St Jakobs. It's going to be interesting for the commuters over the next few weeks.

Was looking at a map and didn't see Olympic drive. Saw Rt 20 out of Niagara - then route 8 thru Hamilton - then to the 403 to he 407.  Not sure what route 8 is like through Hamilton. Is 403 not a good choice to connect into 407  Thanks guys. Rich
407 starts off of the 403 at this end
I was trying to avoid the 403  Fair enough!
Rich, traffic will be deverted up the Redhill Parkway/Lincoln Alexander Parkway and then down the 403 on the west side of Hamilton...It'll be bad if you hit it at morning or afternoon rushhour...

looks like I'll be waking up a bit earlier! taking ridge rd and down the mcneilly hill access haha  http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/hamilton/news/burlington-skyway-crash-driver-to-be-charged-with-impaired-driving-1.2724276

Eastport is not an option? Probably packed though.....Or 53 in a pinch... I would avoid the red hill and the linc during the rush.. Just my opinion having lived there. Thankfully I no longer do.  Any word on charges for the driver? Company?  G

Was looking at a map and didn't see Olympic drive. Saw Rt 20 out of Niagara - then route 8 thru Hamilton - then to the 403 to he 407.  Not sure what route 8 is like through Hamilton. Is 403 not a good choice to connect into 407  Thanks guys. Rich 403 may be OK on Saturday morning, take 20 to where it enters hamilton, Centennial Parkway, there is a GM dealer on the south west corner, a shopping plaza on the north west corner and keep going straight till you intersect with Upper Gage, go south NORTH !on Upper Gage to the Lincoln Alexander expressway, go west and it will intersect with the 403. Take 403 east bound (Toronto) and you will reach the 407.
Now the driver has been charged with impaired. I hope he loses his license for life. Won't happen, but it would be nice.

If you are heading through on Saturday morning then you are better off staying on the QEW maybe. You will be diverted across the lift bridge.. either that or take the Redhill up to the linc, then on to the 403.. if its before 8 on a Saturday you shouldn't have too much trouble.. finding a good traffic report on the weekend can be difficult... try 680 news or 900 chml
It would be around 10:00 or11:00am when I get there.  Maybe the worst will be over by then.
Thought about that too.  We got diverted onto that a couple years ago coming home - due to construction I believe
